props.name: alignContent
props.description: Content alignment for when visuals are present.

props.name: block
props.description: Allow button width to fill its container.

props.name: count
props.description: For counter buttons, the number to display.

props.name: inactive
props.description:
Whether the button looks visually disabled, but can still accept all the same interactions as an enabled button.
 This is intended to be used when a system error such as an outage prevents the button from performing its usual action.
 Inactive styles are slightly different from disabled styles because inactive buttons need to have an accessible color contrast ratio. This is because inactive buttons can have tooltips or perform an action such as opening a dialog explaining why it's inactive.
 If both `disabled` and `inactive` are true, `disabled` takes precedence.

props.name: leadingIcon
props.description: An icon to display before the button text.

props.name: leadingVisual
props.description: A visual to display before the button text.

props.name: loading
props.description: When true, the button is in a loading state.

props.name: loadingAnnouncement
props.description: The content to announce to screen readers when loading. This requires `loading` prop to be true

props.name: trailingIcon
props.description: An icon to display after the button text.

props.name: trailingVisual
props.description: A visual to display after the button text.

props.name: variant
props.description: Change the visual style of the button.

props.name: labelWrap
props.description: Whether the button label should wrap to multiple lines of it is longer than the button width.
